text:
Re-write of old review (again) - 
I've been making this dish since spring of 2002.  Instead of using salsa, I used 1 can of diced tomatoes with green chili (first time I made this, I was out of salsa so I substituted a can of RoTel..have been making it without the salsa ever since!).  I put the entire package of taco seasoning (low sodium variety) in a ziploc bag, and dredge the chicken breasts.  Next, I poured some of the liquid off the tomatoes into the bottom of an 8x8 glass baking dish (I did this instead of greasing). I then placed the chicken breasts in the dish, and added a little fresh cracked pepper, and topped them with the tomatoes, and a dash or two of chipotle tobasco sauce.  Bake in a 400f oven for 30-35 mins- or if you cook with Science...temp to 140...carryover heat will finish it off)  Remove from oven.  Sprinkle with cheese and place back in oven for 3 mins or till cheese has melted.  (here's where carryover comes into play...) After your cheese is melted, take it out of the oven and remove it from the baking dish.  Cover with foil and let it rest for about 10 minutes.  This lets all the juices reabsorb.  Top with a dab sour cream. I serve this usually with spanish rice, mexican style corn (for this type of corn in a jiff...add some red/black pepper flakes, a little mrs dash,and 2-3 dashes of tobasco sauce..the man will even sometimes top the corn with a dab of shredded cheese), and a salad. Thanks for a great recipe!! Definitely a keeper!

text:
ORIGINAL REVIEW: May 17, 2005. I was surprized to see this recipe roaming around on this site. I've been making this for years, ever since my husband and I first got together.

Sometimes, I will dredge the chicken in melted margerine/butter, then tortilla chips I've ground in the blender
that have been mixed with the taco seasoning. Then I'll use the sour cream/salsa as a dipping sauce, just to change things up.

Either way, it's a favorite in this house. If you don't have time to make a side to go with this, serve it with Zatarains Spanish Rice with a can of drained black beans stirred in.

EDITED: I make this now at least once a month. I now use my own homemade taco seasoning, green salsa sometimes, mexican cheese and reduced fat sour cream. It's good with pretty much anything, either wrapped up in tortillas or served with a side of steamed brown rice and sauteed onions and peppers. We love this dish.

text:
Excellent! I cooked this in the crockpot today. I put a very thin layer of salsa in the bottom of the crockpot. Then I took a package of "Taco Time" (the best) taco seasoning mix and put it into a plastic bag...put the chicken inside the bag to complete cover. I then took the chicken and put it on top of the salsa...covered the top of the chicken with a thin layer of salsa. Put the setting on low for about 6 hours...amazing. I didn't have time to melt the cheese on top but I'll be sure to do that next time. This turned out to be very moist...very kid friendly!!

text:
Ok, I swear this is the last time I edit this review!!  I give this recipe 2-3 stars as written, & 5 stars made the way I prepare it.  I have made this many many times - the first time we did not care for it as I followed the recipe to a t - The chicken came out very bland.  With a few alterations on the recipe, I have come up with my husband's very favorite dish!  I toss the chicken in a ziploc bag with a packet of taco seasoning.  Then I pour a little salsa in the bottom of the casserole, add the coated chicken breasts, then pour over the rest of the salsa.  I cook it for about 35 minutes.  Then I remove it, and add some Mexican melting cheese & fresh chopped jalepenos, and cook for another 5 minutes.  It is sooooo good!  I have also found that a slice of pepperjack cheese tastes really good too, but there is something about that Mexican melting cheese & fresh diced jalapenos that leaves my hubby & I salivating!

text:
Very easy and very quick, yet it tastes so good people will think you slaved for hours over this dish! I used "Taco Seasoning I" from this site for the taco seasoning and used Ortega's Medium chunky style salsa (a bit more than called for) and light Mexican blend cheese. After it comes out of the oven I pretty it up a bit by topping it off with some sliced black olives and thin sliced green onions.The chicken is tender, juicy and oh so good! It's perfect topped off with dollup of light sour cream and a side of Spanish rice - YUM!

text:
Very Tasty!  I too used the mild taco seasoning and instead of shaking it in a bag I just eyeballed it and shook some on each side.  Used a slow cooker.  Put down a layer of El Pato Sauce then placed the chicken and topped it with a jar of mild Old El Paso Thick & Chunky.  Cooked it on low while I was at work (use the crock pot liners - they ROCK) and the house smelled wonderful when I came home.  The chicken breasts literally fell apart like a fine roast.  Served it with white rice and steamed "Mexican veggie blend" (white corn, black beans, peppers and onions).  The broth from the pot made a yummy topping for the rice.  Almost like a Taco Soup.  Very nice - husband requested it to be a regular at our house!

text:
My boys have loved this recipe for years, but I have done a slight variation, which they seem to enjoy even more.  Place 4 - 6 boneless chicken breasts in the crockpot, season with 1 pkt taco seasoning, cover with 8 oz salsa mixed with 1 can of crm. of chicken soup.  Cook 4 hours on high or 8 hours on low.  Take chicken out and shred with fork.  Place back in salsa mixture.  Serve over rice with shredded cheese & sour cream or even in tortillas... Yum!!  Update:  add can of drained black beans & corn.  Double Yum!

text:
This dish is AMAZING with a few changes! First off, don't use out of the bag taco seasoning. Instead, make your own! I use the following mix: 1 teaspoon paprika, 2 teaspoons ground cumin, 1 teaspoon cayenne pepper, 1 teaspoon oregano, 2 teaspoons garlic powder. Secondly, pound the breasts so they're relatively flat- this gives a better spice to chicken flavor ratio, and prevents you from getting the thicker chunks of chicken that are bland. It also helps even cooking. Don't just "sprinkle it on"- rub the spices on both sides of the chicken! I rub it on once side, place that side face down in the pan (which I spray with cooking spray before hand), then when they're all in the pan go and season and rub the other sides. Latly, use a shredded mexican cheese mix blend (also called nacho/taco mix) instead of cheddar cheese. We love this so much, I double the recipe and use a 9x12 to bake all of it. I always serve this with the Spanish Rice II recipe from this site- check out my review on that recipe for great alterations for the best outcome. Bland? Absolutely NOT! You don't even need the sour cream! I serve this to people and they RAVE about it! Give the changes a try- you won't be disappointed!

text:
WHY THIS IS 5 STARS: Simply because you can make something that is CHEAP and SURPRISINGLY delicious in 5 minutes ...and that's going really slow!  Don't bother looking at the specifics as far as amounts.  Or even what it will taste like with "ick" taco seasoning on it... first off, you won't taste the taco seasoning and that's with putting a large amount over entire breast.  To finish this in 25 min at 375, you should pound these to 1/2" thick (basically take one breast and cut in half).   Put pam in a 13X9, breasts, seasoning (again, don't be shy), then put any salsa on.  I fit as much as I can fit on each breast.  Even using hot, the cheese really subdues the hotness so don't worry about it.  My toddlers eat it and they typically don't like MEAT (guess the key is all the cheese lol).  Bake, and then as stated, sprinkle as much of any kind of cheese on top for the last 5-10 min.  So simple.  If you want an equally simple and QUICK mexican rice, try "BEST SPANISH RICE"  ...you'll be shocked by the taste!

text:
Good as written, but with a few minor variations, this is an awesome dish. I coat the chicken (either breasts or legs) with the Taco seasoning, pour in a can of Salsa Verde (or Green salsa), add a squeeze of lime, some salt, and a pinch of sugar. Then marinate overnight. The next day, pour everything into a baking dish, add more salsa so it covers the chicken, and bake until done (or put in a crockpot). At the last minute, sprinkle shredded Monterey Jack cheese over the chicken, and put back in oven until melted. Serve over yellow rice. Amazing!

This review has been updated. 

EXCELLENT! Yes, I'm shouting but for all the right reasons. It was so easy and simple to make and it came out very tasty. The sour cream should be included as a 'mandatory' ingredient since it adds a bit more flavor. Next time, as a suggestion to those who like their food spicy as I do, I'll add finely chopped chili peppers and mix them in the salsa sauce before pouring it over the chicken. I'll definitely make this simple yet tasty dish again.  Kudos to the creator of this wonderful recipe.

This is a great and easy chicken dish.  I shook the chicken breasts in a plastic bag with the taco seasoning mix.  I used "Herdez" mild salsa and poured the entire jar over the chicken.  I also added a small can of sliced black olives.  When the chicken was done, I sprinkled a good bit of Mexican cheese on top, baked the chicken the last few minutes. I served this with the Mexican Rice recipe found on this site, a can of black beans and a dollop of sour cream.

This was really good, especially considering how few ingredients went into it. I spread a can of refried beans into the bottom of the dish and then set the chicken on top. I just poured a packet of taco seasoning into a quart-sized ziploc, threw the chicken in, and gave it a few good shakes. I also used a fiesta blend of cheeses instead. Very simple and easy, and very good!

text:
I made this for dinner tonight.  I had to make a variation in the recipe because I found that I didn't have salsa in my pantry.  I DID have Mexican Style Tomatoes which I felt would work just as well.  I pureed these in my food processor along with the taco seasoning then poured it over the chicken.  I also added Vidalia Onion slivers and tri-color peppers that I purchased frozen at Trader Joe's, placing the vegetables on top of the chicken pieces.  I baked the chicken and added the cheese and my family LOVED this dish!  It just couldn't have been easier to make and even though it didn't have the bite medium salsa would have had, the dish was a hit!  Either way you make the recipe you will end up with a tender, flavorful piece of chicken that your family will be sure to love:)  Most certainly a keeper!

text:
This is one of those "why didn't I think of that?" recipes!  I used black bean and corn salsa, and I was very lazy and just crammed the chicken into the first baking dish I saw ( a 1 1/2 qt casserole) and dumped the whole jar of salsa over the chicken instead of just one cup. Between the smaller dish and the extra salsa, the chicken just stewed until it was so moist and tender you could cut it with a fork! Oh, and by all means, PLEASE use the Taco Seasoning l recipe from this site instead of storebought!

I add 2 cups raw rice sauteed with butter, onions, bell pepper and  jalapeno peppers and place in the bottom  of the baking dish with 1 cup chicken broth. Add the chicken on top and bake. text:
Giving 5 stars is SO rare for me. I give this 5 stars over all.

It was SO easy, and very yummy. My husband loved it, too.

I used 4 ginormous chicken breasts... and a whole packet of taco seasoning on both sides. I used a mix of Chi Chi's & Newmans own salsas and LOADED it with cheese.

I served it as follows - I spread a layer of refried beans over the bottom of the plates... placed the chicken on the beans, surrounded the beans in a circle of spanish rice, topped with a dollop of sour cream and spooned a little salsa on top of the sour cream.

It was very pretty, and so yummy. Clean up and prep time were minimal. Fantastic quick & easy meal. 

Thank you!

text:
My whole family liked this dish very much. I too cut the chicken into strips and served it in soft tortillas with lettuce and tomato. For a little twist on this recipe; saute chicken and bell pepper in a pan.  Add salsa, 3 heaping tablespoons of peanut butter, 3 tsp. lite soy sauce, 1 tsp. ginger and garlic to taste.  Simmer for about 15 minutes, serve over rice and sprinkle with peanuts.  You can't taste the peanut butter, but it gives the sauce a wonderful flavor.

text:
Delicious, few ingredients and 5 minutes to prepare...this is definately worth 5 stars! I took a suggestion from another reviewer and cut my chicken breasts into big bite-size pieces, tossed them with the entire pack of Old El Paso taco seasoning in a zip-lock bag and baked for 15 minutes (with black bean and corn salsa on top).  Then added the cheese and crushed tortilla chips and baked for a oouple more minutes.  Served with Mexican rice and refried beans.  So very good!! Full of flavor, husband just loved it!

This has become part of our regular household menu.  You can also try this recipe in your slow cooker.  Just use the whole package of taco spices/seasonings and whole jar of salsa.  cook on low 6 hours or until chicken is done.  Top each breast with cheese before serving.

WOW!  I have never made a meal that was this easy that tasted this good.  I mean really.  THe chicken was done...juicy, and VERY tasty.  I was a little hesitant because my husband does not care for spicey foods but this was great.  I used medium salsa and coated the chicken he would eat lightly with the taco seasoning, and coated mine heavily and added jalapeno's on top of the sour cream on mine.  This is a perfect recipe.  Tasty, simple and very "pretty".  The red sauce, cheese, sour cream and jalapeno's (on mine) were so colorful that it looked GREAT on a plate.  I would serve this for company.  Thanks so much for the great recipe!!  I would give it another star if I could.

text:
I've made this before but in a crockpot. You add the chicken breast (4-6) in a crockpot, can of cream of chicken soup, 1/2 the pack of taco seasoning (whole pack was too salty for my taste), one small jar of salsa of your choice.. Cook on low for 8 hrs, or high for about 4 hrs.. It's quick it's easy and I put it together before work and it's done when I come home..

text:
Like other reviewers have said, this really is surprisingly delicious.  I used Tyson frozen boneless breasts - I did not thaw them.  I used home-made taco seasoning (so much better than the store bought!).  I baked it at 375 for 50 min (since my chicken was still frozen) and then sprinkeled the cheese on and put it back in the oven for a couple of minutes while I finished my sides (white rice and peas).  Served with sour cream on top and it was amazingly tender and so good!

PLATO712

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/337275.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
My boyfriend is Mexican and he absolutely loved the flavor of this dish and said it was the most authentic I have ever made!  Although this recipe is perfect, I added a few additional ingredients to give it more kick for my personal tastes. Before I put the chicken in the pan, I added 1/2 cup of chicken broth.  I then added about 12-15oz jar of green salsa for my salsa contribution.  Then I cut about 8 small red potatoes into wedgies and placed them around the chick in the salsa.  I also sprinkled fresh cut cilantro and 1 tsp of cumin over the top. I covered with tinfoil and cook 45 min to allow potatoes to soften.  It was not only yummi but the potatoes and chicken simmer in this salsa base so there is extra for topping! YUMMI!  Try it...you won't be dissapointed!  Take the tinfoil off about 5 min before it's done to let some of the moisture evaporate.

text:
Made this last week for my husband and picky son.  Son didn't have any because he wasn't feeling well but has asked me to make it again because it smelled so good.  My husband quite liked it as well.  I found that there wasn't enough salsa to cover the chicken so will need to add more next time.  My friend made it the same week and shook seasoning with chicken in a zipper bag and she said it was great like that (more evenly coated with seasoning).  Might try it that way next time (this weekend!).  Looks like it's going to be a staple in our house!    Lucyfrog - Hamilton, Canada  UPDATE:  I make this quite regularly now, and the kids (big & small) can't get enough of it!  I've given the recipe to many family and friends and they all LOVE IT!

text:
This was by far a wonderful chicken recipe. Unlike most leave the chicken pretty bland. I followed the recipe like it says, EXCEPT, I slow cooked it. I let my boneless chicken breast thaw overnight and in my crockpot I poured a thin layer of Salsa (Pace), then I put the chicken in a ziplock w/Taco Seasoning and made sure the chicken was coated well. Laid it out in crockpot, added Rotel - let it cook for about 4 hrs, turn the crock pot off.... then add cheese, and blk olives. Leave the top on crock pot while you cook sides. I served my dish with Mexican Rice, and Mexican Corn. As folks made their plate, they added sour cream on top of the chicken. Delicious! I will forsure make this again! Very easy and Yes it makes your house smell wonderful! :) Everyone LOVED it!

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
I think the difference between people who liked this and people who didn't comes down to your taco seasoning and your salsa. Use varieties you like, and really you're best off using homemade salt-free taco seasoning for this or else I could see it just being too much everything (mostly salt). We enjoyed this a great deal (did not use optional sour cream, that's quite enough dairy in the cheese!) but that would've been lovely. This was by far the most tender baked chicken dish I have ever made (barring the olden days when I baked chicken breasts in condensed soup!). The only drawback was that some of my cheese did not fit on my chicken, so it sort of fell off, and then no one would eat it because it got sort of...chicken-juiced and too wet in the bottom of the dish. So I'll reduce the amount of cheese I use next time, so that I waste none :) Thanks for this easy, tasty, and attractively-plateable recipe.

text:
Delicious and it couldn't be easier! I made the recipe as written, using only three chicken breasts. Mine took the full 35 minutes to cook as they were thick chicken breasts. I used reduced- fat sharp cheddar cheese and fat free sour cream to top it off. My hubby and 6-year old ate theirs sliced and wrapped in tortillas. I ate mine as is. The chicken was juicy and spicy. My little guy gave it five stars...something he doesn't do too often! Thanks for posting! *****Update****** 2/17/09 I just made this in the crock pot and it was delicious! I used 4 boneless chicken breasts and rubbed them with the taco seasoning. I put them in the crock pot, poured the salsa over them and also poured in about half a cup of water. I cooked on low for 4 hours, took them out and sliced them into strips and put them back in for another 30 minutes. I served them on tortillas with shredded jack cheese and sour cream. My six-year old gobbled his up and then ate half of mine!!!

text:
The recipe as written is great. Like many reviewers I have been making this for years. One time when making it I found my chicken breasts varied greatly in size so I cubed them all to about 1.5 inches each. This worked out great as the salsa and taco seasoning had more surface area to absorb into. If you do the same make sure to watch your cooking time as it will be less with the smaller pieces.

Display Name:
moonlali

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674146.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I looooved this meal.  I took the advice of others and put some taco seasoning in a bag and shook the chicken pieces to coat (we didn't find it too spicy at all).  I put a thin layer of salsa down in the 9x13 dish, and then placed the coated pieces on top of it.  I eyeballed the amount of salsa and ended up using about half of a mild Pace salsa bottle (which was very tasty).  At 25 minutes the chicken was at 165 (I had thin breast tenders).  I put shredded sharp cheddar cheese (also eyeballed, but it was probably about a cup or cup and 1/2) on the dish and cooked for a few minutes more.  I topped with sour cream (def would make sure to have sour cream).  It was tender and delicious.  I made Tortillas II and some quick spanish rice.  Wonderful meal - this will definitely be in my permanent rotation because it's so quick and easy and yummy!

text:
very good chicken salsa! Simple and easy to prepare. I marinated the chicken breasts in a resealable plastic bag with taco seasoning and a little water (1/4cup) for about 6 hours. The baking time took an extra 15 minutes for the three chicken breasts. I used mexican blended cheese to top off the chicken with. I served this with "spanish rice original", from this website. This was a pretty tasty meal, everyone loves salsa, chicken and cheese. An easy meal to put together on a busy weekday night. My family says this dish tastes like enchiladas only without the tortillas. A great recipe that I will add this to my recipe box.

text:
this was tasty.  i used the marinade option, mixing 4T of taco seasoning and 2/3 cup water and letting our 2 chicken breasts sit in it for about 60-90 minutes.  instead of oven baking it, i cooked this dish in a skillet on the stove (oven baked chicken always takes longer than the recipe, it seems to me).  used a T or 2 of olive oil and put in about 1/4 cup of the marinade as well as the chicken, covered and simmered for about 20 minutes.  i added the salsa in for the final 5-10 minutes and then sprinkled cheese on top as it was served.  husband said it was good, it was tender and spicy enough that i wish we hadn't been out of sour cream.  good recipe :)

text:
WOW! This recipe was really good!!! I went through some of the reviews and took advice from a few. I used 1 pkt of Taco Bell taco seasoning and 2/3 cups water to make a marinade. I then put that and the chicken in a plastic bag to coat well and marinade overnight. I used a crock-pot to cook the chicken...thin layer of salsa on bottom and another layer over the chicken. I cooked it 6hours on low. I had to use a large spoon to take the chicken out, it was THAT tender!! We then added cheese and salsa, fantastic!! The leftovers were even better. Only negative (small one at that) is that there is so much salsa left over, it would be nice to find a use for it. I highly recommend this recipe to everyone!

city:

country:
None
text:
This is such an easy... yet such a great dish. My husband just loved it. So did I. I used the taco seasoning like a rub and then sauted the chicken in butter. I poured homemade salsa on top and let the juices run around the chicken. I covered the top of the wok in alluminum foil to keep the steam from escaping and let it steam about 8 minutes. The chicken was so tender and juicy. I made white rice in vegetable stock and served the chicken on top. I also served a fresh salad sprinkled with a little taco mix. The taco mix gave the salad a great taste, and we didn't need any dressing which saved calories. I also served a vegetable on the side. This was truly such a wonderful meal. My husband requested it again the next day! because I sauted it in the wok instead of baking it the taste was a little richer. The butter added to the taste and the sauce it created was wonderful on the rice. (Edited April 21, 2011... I regularly use Rotel instead of salsa... which is usually homemade... but I would note that if you use rotel instead of the salsa you should dice up some onions to add since it better resembles a salsa in the end)

userID:
1503742
Display Name:
CaptMicha

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/160216.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
A very simple yet delicious dish. Since I was only cooking for myself, I made one serving. What I did differently was I tried following other members' advice and I put the chicken in a bag with the taco seasoning and shaking it to coat. The coating kept falling off I emptied the seasoning on a plate and pressed the chicken onto it. This worked really well.

Then, I cut a large square of aluminum foil and put a shallow layer of medium salsa on the bottom, which I then placed the chicken on. I poured a thicker layer of salsa on top of the chicken and folded the foil around to create a pocket. Then I placed it in a pan incase of spills.

I cooked it for 25 minutes and then unfolded the foil and left the top bare to sprinkle cheese on and then I put it back into the oven this way for five minutes. I only had smoked cheddar but it still tasted great.

The chicken came out tasty and moist. The taco seasoning you use plays a large role in the taste. I used hot and spicy Old Del Paso. It wasn't too bold.

text:
I was stunned at how great this tasted, especially considering how simple it is to make!  You can throw this together in the time it takes to remove a TV dinner from the freezer and stick it in the oven.  This is truly 'stress-free' cooking as it can be scaled up or down with ease.  I just put a generous sprinkling of the taco seasoning on both sides of the chicken and poured on enough salsa to cover the top of each chicken piece.  Ditto for the cheese.  The chicken comes out so moist and flavorful.  I am not a big fan of rice, so I serve this with refried beans and frozen corn.  Delish!!!  Don't be fooled into thinking it can't possibly be good because it has so few ingredients.  This stuff rocks!!  For me, the sour cream is required, though.  It mellows the whole thing out and makes it that much richer tasting.

text:
This was soooo delicious!! Before cooking, I "stabbed" chicken with knife to make sure all flavors got into it, then placed chicken into a ziploc bag with half a packet of mild taco seasoning, along with about a 1/8 cup of water. I let sit in refrigerator about an hour before cooking, i then followed the recipe, except i didnt have shredded cheddar cheese, so on each breast i just placed half of a slice of kraft cheese, with some shredded mozzarella cheese. I served it with some white rice. this turned out great and i will definitely be making it again. thank you for such a great recipe :]
Review:
Rating:
5
dateLastModified:
2007-08-22T17:36:10.72

text:
This was SO yummy!  And I cooked this on the stovetop, in a skillet instead.  I only had the quick frozen chicken breasts and started them out in the skillet, sprayed with cooking spray.  Put the lid on for about 5 minutes, then sprinkled the taco mix on top.  Covered for a couple minutes more, then added the salsa.  Put lid on again another 10 minutes or so, simmering low.  Then turned up to high, lid off to reduce the sauce.  Turned heat off, topped with cheese, lid back on for a min. to melt the cheese.  Served the sauce over the rice!  SO GOOD!  Even the kids liked it.

text:
Super easy weeknight supper!  Here's a tried and true tip: Cut the chicken breasts into thin strips; put in a ziploc bag with seasoning; seal and shake; add salsa; marinate for a few hours or overnight; Follow the rest of the recipe.  I suggest making spicy rice and corn as sides.  For easy lunches the next day or another quick weeknight dinner, mix the leftover chicken, rice, and corn together; microwave, and serve in warmed flour tortillas!  YUM!

Very easy and delicious recipe!  I have made it twice - first by the exact recipe.  Second time, I added 3/4 c. raw rice to the bottom of the pan, stirred in 1+ tsp. of taco seasoning and poured in approximately 1 1/2 cups chicken broth.  I then laid the prepared chicken on top. text:
Loved this recipe. I did use bone-in breasts because that was what was on sale. Will use boneless next time to make it easier to eat. Put on the seasoning and baked 1/2 hour, then added the salsa (Pace Picante sauce, actually) and baked another 1/2 hour. Then, added the cheese and baked another 15 minutes. The tomatoes actually caramelize a bit, and really enhances the flavor. So very simple, yet tastes amazing! Served with a side of re-fried beans (with salsa and cheese added), and broccoli.

text:
This is the best salsa chicken I've ever made. I used the "Taco Seasoning I" from this website, instead of store bought, and fresh medium salsa. It had great flavor but was a little spicy for the kids (nothing a little sour cream couldn't fix). I added about a cup of reduced sodium chicken broth to the bottom of the pan at the beginning and then added some cooked brown rice during the last few minutes to soak up the broth. Amazing!!! Just had the left overs for lunch and it's even better the second time around. This recipe will be going into my normal weekday rotation. It was inexpensive and easy to prepare. I'll never make salsa chicken in the crock pot again. This was is much more moist!

Simple, easy, yummy and I had all the ingredients on hand.  Thank goodness because I hadn't planned ahead!  The only change/addition I made was to sprinkle some crushed tortilla chips on top as suggested by another reviewer.  If I had not been short on time, I would have rolled the chicken in the chips. This was a hit! I used five chicken breasts,,,added the whole packet of taco seasoning..medium Picante sauce...more cheese and used Mexican four cheese blend and added cut up green onions with the cheese for the last few minutes...and a squeeze of fresh lime before serving. text:
For how easy this was, I was surprised at how tasty it ended up being with what I had. I had 4 chicken breast halves, packet of taco seasoning, a can of Zucchini with Italian Style Tomato Sauce, one tomato and one jalapeÃ±o. I basically drained the can's juices into my baking dish; drenched the chicken in the taco seasonings; placed the chicken into the baking dish; poured the zucchinis on top of the chicken; put the diced tomatoes and jalapeÃ±os I had on top of that; placed into the oven and called it day. I put one portion on top of quinoa and it made for one tasty meal! I'll do this again for sure! Thanks for the recipe which inspired a remix...

text:
Delicious and really easy!  I had huge chicken breasts, and I was afraid they wouldn't cook evenly, so I diced them up into bite sized pieces, sprinkled the pieces with the taco seasoning, and poured the salsa over.  I stirred it while it was cooking, so the chicken was well coated and seemed to soak up a lot of flavor.  I made seasoned rice to go with it, rolled everything up in tortillas with sour cream, lettuce and tomatoes.  Delish!

text:
Super easy, super tasty, what more can you ask for?  I made this as directed in the oven and it turned out great.  My one tip is that this gets really wet as written and your chicken ends up boiling instead of baking.  I am very careful to put the salsa on just the top of the chicken and I use a fork to get it out of the jar to get rid of some of the juice.  I pull it out of the oven a couple of times and soak up the juices with a paper towel to keep it dry.  This makes for a nicer finished product.

text:
If I could grasp the quality and quantity of time in the rest of my day as I was able to do with this recipe, I'd be superwoman! I was surprised how delicious and easy this was. My 13 year old girl and husband went back or 2nds AND 3rd's. I even got 2 "This is really good!" remarks from my husband who enjoys but rarely remarks on my cooking. I pretty much followed the recipe but normally add a little to suit my family's taste. My husband is Cajun so flavor and spice is a must.  I did add some grilled corn which I seasoned with butter, cayenne, cumin, pepper, and cilantro. (Which by the way was delicious by itself) and threw in on the chicken when I added the cheese. After reading the reviews, I will try it in the slow cooker next time. I took the advise on one reviewer and let the chicken rest and absorb the liquid by removing it from the pan when it was done cooking and covering it with foil for 10 minutes. It was incredibly tender for oven baked chicken. Thank you for this recipe! It will definitely be a regular for our house!!

text:
I made this but i changed it a little. I rolled the chicken breasts in taco seasoning/taco sauce i used from a boxed dinner kit(was running short on supplies) then put the chicken in a baking pan that had a layer of corn and mushrooms. On top I layered diced green bell peppers and very chuncky salsa. when the chicken was almost done i put a layer of mexican cheese blend(so much better than plain chedder)on top,melted it until done. Served this with seasoned rice and soft taco shells. This was a huge hit with the family! The reason I give this a 5 star is because this recipe is a great starter recipe for those new to cooking. You can add or subtract to your liking or skill as you go along! Thank you Faye for sharing a great recipe!

Display Name:

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/global/features/3054.gif
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I've been making a variation of this recipe for years, and it is a family favorite and frequent request. I add quite a few more items to my version, although the base recipe exactly as listed above is also delicious!

Here's my variation:

Cover chicken breasts with a dash of taco seasoning, plus some garlic powder, black pepper and (the secret ingredient) Cinnamon -- the cinnamon gives it a rich and slightly sweet flavor, which mixes very well with the other ingredients. I add just a pinch of cinnamon to almost all of my Mexican dishes.

Layer salsa (experiment with different varieties -- I have even used corn salsa before with great results). I will sometimes also add a thin layer of chile con queso if I have it on hand.

Crush up a few handfulls of corn chips and sprinkle on top, then add the cheese as directed in the base recipe.

You really can't go wrong, and this is a great recipe to experiment on!

My husband ranked this easy dish as the best chicken recipe that he has ever had...and he talked about it ALL night long!  We will definitely make it again.  Thanks for the great recipe!

I love this recipe, my husband does also. I have made it for dinner parties and it is always a big hit. I use more salsa than it says, but that is just because I love salsa. Also, the first time I made it I didn't have taco seasoning at my house, I only had fajita seasoning, it was fantastic and hat is how I have made it every time. I give this recipe out every chance I get! I would highly suggest making it!

I added about 1 cup of sweet corn and cooked this int he crockpot (low, 8 hours). I love how meat in the crockpot literally crumbles apart. I served this over white rice. If it weren't for the addition of sour cream and cheese I would've given it 2 stars. There just wasn't much flavor...perhaps it was because I cooked it in the crockpot? Either way, this was not a 4 or 5 star recipe for me like so many others think. Perhaps I'll try it once more in the oven. I thought it was bland.

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5677173.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Took me 2 minutes to put together. Used one packet of taco seasoning, dumped it in a ziplock bag then put 2 lbs of chicken tenders and shook it up. Placed a thin layer of picante sauce on the bottom of the crock pot, placed the tenders on top and arranged them evenly. Poured enough picante sauce to cover the chicken. Everything was eyeballed. Cooked it on high for 4 hours and the meat fell apart when we ate it. I forgot to add the cheese on top and didn't have any sour cream. It tasted great without it anyways. It's so easy that my lack-of-cooking-skills hubby could make it. However, he highly doubts that he could make something this tasty.

text:
I've been making a similar version for years (and here I thought I made it up! LOL).  The only difference in my method was that I sprinkled the taco seasoning on the chicken breasts and then browned them before baking in salsa.  This way is just easier and you don't have the extra pan to wash.  Delicious and good for you!

text:
For such a simple recipe, this wasn't too shabby. My husband loved it [he has "simple" tastes...;)], but I thought it was just alright overall. I think a homemade salsa (or pico de gallo with fresh tomato juice) would be better than the jarred variety I used my first time making this tonight. I wouldn't necessarily think of serving such a basic dish for company, but for a quick weeknight dinner, it wasn't bad. I bet it would be even better if the chicken was grilled. We will probably be making this again. Thanks!
EDIT - As it turns out, I found I liked this dish better as leftovers the next day. More time for the flavors to mingle.

text:
This was fantastic! I took someone else's advice and dumped some salsa on the bottom of my baking dish and clean up was a breeze. I used a cinnamon sugar shaker to season the chicken with the taco mix. It applied the perfect amount. I also did what someone else said and covered the chicken once it was out of the oven with foil for 10 minutes to let the juices settle - never had such juicy chicken. Super easy and super delish! Thanks!

My changes: It goes into the crockpot! Add chicken, top with mexican style diced tomatoes instead of salsa (OR rotel + plain diced tomatoes); taco seasoning. High 4 hrs. or low 8 hrs. top w/ sour cream and cheese, on a tortilla! Can add black beans and/or corn as well. YUM!

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614260.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Super Easy!  I have made this many times with a few variations.  I spread a thin layer of black beans on the bottom of the casserole dish before adding the chicken.  In 40 minutes or so you've got a healthy 1-dish meal full of fiber and protein.  I typically squeeze fresh lime juice on the chicken before sprinkling on the taco seasoning for a tangy kick.  I have used both salsa and canned diced tomatoes to top the chicken and both variations are yummy.  A little cheese is nice- I choose a strong flavor like sharp cheddar.  Optional: add a few crushed corn chips or tortilla strips.

text:
The chicken breasts were still frozen so I cut them up in small pieces, spread some home made salsa in bottom of glass casserole, seasoned the chicken with home made fajita/taco seasoning and placed over salsa, then spread the remaining salsa over the top. I baked it at 350 for about 30 minutes, then served over white rice and sprinkled grated cheese over the top with a dollop of sour cream and Frank's Hot Sauce. Delicious, quick and easy. Everyone liked it. Kyle 4 starts, Denny 4-1/2 and me 4-1/2.

text:
Yum! I got home from work and realized that I'd neglected to take the chicken breasts out of the freezer.  I plopped 3 large, frozen chicken breasts in the baking dish, sprinkled a packet of taco seasoning over them and spooned some medium salsa on top, then into the oven at 375 for about an hour. Then I shredded them with a couple of forks and put it back in the over for about 10 minutes to make sure every shred was seasoned, then made soft tacos with shredded lettuce and cheese. So easy, very tasty! Even my meatloaf-and-mashed-potatoes husband liked it.

text:
Great recipe - I'm a new mom of twins, so time is of the essence when I'm trying to prepare a meal.  Definitely use the Ziploc method - it's kind of impossible to sprinkle the seasoning evenly.  I used extra mild taco sauce to ensure that it wouldn't be too spicy.  End result was great (was still a little spicy but my 3 year old still ate it.  Next time I'll use the Taco Seasoning I from this site to tone down the spices (I've made that recipe before and I don't think it has enough spice/heat for ground beef but it would be perfect for this recipe and I see quite a few other reviewers have used it).  I also think that I could live without the cheese (if you are trying to make it lower in fat).  Thanks for the recipe - wish I wouldn't have waited 2 years to try it ;)

I have been making this recipe for years and all the kids and grownups devour it-everytime! text:
Of course, I changed it up to suit what we had...but the basics of this recipe is great.  I cubed my chicken and coated with taco seasoning and let sit while I sauted onions, garlic and celery (what I had), added the chicken and 2 cans of black beans.  Cooked the chicken for about 15 minutes. Transferred the chicken mixture to a baking dish, added some peppers, poured on the salsa, covered with foil and baked for 20 minutes. Served over brown rice and topped with a little light sour cream and low fat cheese (we are dieting at my house)  And just for fun I cut some strips of corn tortillas and fried in a small amount of oil and put on top!!! YUMMIE

text:
I absolutely loved this recipe - I actually first heard about it on the the Food Network in Canada - Chef at Home. I came on here to see if there were alterations to it. This added taco seasoning mix - I just used a tex mex seasoning as well as some staples like garlic powder, salt, pepper and chili-chipotle powder. I cooked at 350 for only 20 minutes and then added the cheese, baked a couple minutes longer and then turned on the broil for a few minutes. I added sour cream which to me completes this dish - must have the sour cream. It was so moist and tasty. A new favourite chicken dish. I served with Mexican Rice II on this site. Thx!

text:
This chicken makes EXCELLENT tacos! I put the chicken in the crockpot with a can of diced tomatoes and 3/4 jar of Newman's Own Salsa. Coated the chicken with the Taco Seasoning I recipe from this site (GREAT recipe!) and cooked on low for 5.5-6 hours. Shredded with forks and popped into toasted corn tortillas with avocado, lettuce, sour cream, feta cheese and a squeeze of lime juice. I will NEVER make ground turkey tacos again like I used to do! This is how we'll do tacos from now on - restaurant quality! Thanks!

I think that part of the point of the recipe is to be able to make something quickly.  I made the recipe exactly as is, and added nothing extra.  I simply omitted the cheese to cut out some fat.  I don't think it's necessary to use a bag, marinate, etc. as others mentioned.  I recommend preparing this AS IS...it's very moist and simply wonderful!  I baked it for exactly 25 min.

text:
I've found a great new way to cook chicken that not only is delicious but also fast and easy.  Before I left for work on Tuesday I put the chicken brests in a Ziploc bag with the juice from a can of Rotel and the taco seasoning. Put this in the fridge and left it to marinate.  Got home and just completed the dish.  I mixed the rotel contents that were left in the can with the salsa.  It  had a lot of flavor and my biggest surprise was how much my kids who are picky eaters enjoyed it and complemented me.  Thank you Faye.

userID:
1966017
Display Name:
Sarah
isPro:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/44520.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This recipe is awesome! I changed it up a little (okay...maybe a lot), but my inspiration came from the original recipe. First, I used 6 boneless/skinless chicken breasts instead of 4. I coated the chicken with 2 standard-sized packets of taco seasoning (I used "mild", and it had just the right amount of heat for our family), and I threw the chicken in the crock pot, along with about 2 cups of "medium" salsa. I sprinkled about a teaspoon of Goya brand Adobo over everything, and let it go for about 3 1/2 hours on high. Then, I shredded the chicken up using 2 forks, added 2 packets of Goya brand Sazon and 2 regular sized cans of chicken broth, and stirred it all together. I let it cook on high for 30 minutes more, then we had the mixture over white rice with canned sweet corn. It was LOVED by all of us! Thanks so much for sharing!

text:
Amazing!!  I was a little hesitant at first but was impressed with the results.  I didn't use any measurements however which made the quick dish even quicker.  I put the chicken in the dish, sprinkled with seasoning and turned to repeat, spooned salsa on to cover and put a silce of cheddar cheese on near the end of cookoing time.  Once cooked I removed the chicken and added some cooked white rice the the leftover watery salsa mess in the dish to absorb the flavour and then served that along with corn.  Finding a side dished that suited this dish was difficult for me but the rice works really well!  Thanks so much for sharing!

text:
This recipe was GREAT! I love salsa and I seriously think I could eat this chicken everyday! I served it with yellow rice and a side salad. 

It also is a simple recipe method that can be used with other flavors. I used the same recipe to make italian chicken, only instead of taco mix I used italian seasoning, garlic powder, and pepper. Topped it with a can of diced italian style tomatoes and then at the last 5 minutes sprinkled mozarella cheese until bubbly. Great simple recipe that is wonderful either with salsa or made italian style! THANKS SO MUCH!

My family loves this recipe. I put a little salsa in the bottom of my pan, rub the chicken with taco seasoning mix and then place it on top of the salsa. text:
This was surprisingly fantastic. I say surprisingly because it was so easy, I assumed it would taste like nothing special. I was wrong. It tasted like I'd spent a ton of time preparing, etc.  The presentation was beautiful with the sour cream dollop on top. It definitely NEEDS the sour cream on it to make the dish. The chicken was remarkably juicy. I used one whole packet (i.e., more than the recipe required) of taco seasoning to cover the top & bottom of each breast.  I served with a box of chicken flavored rice/vermecelli, which was actually a terrific balance to all the Mexican flavors. A Spanish rice on the side would have been way too much of the same flavor, so I do recommend choosing a non-Mexican/Spanish side accompaniment.  Great fast recipe that will look like you worked a lot harder than you did!!!

I wasn't sure if we'd like this but it seemed simple enough for a quick meal tonight without much fuss.  After having a baby 2 weeks ago I needed something FAST.  This was great.  I did use chicken tenderloins instead of breasts and I took a taco seasoning packet and put it in a sandwich baggie and "coated" the chicken that way, instead.  I put a little bit of water in the bottom of the pan while cooking, too.  The "coated" chicken had a BITE to it.  EXTREMELY SPICY.....so sour cream would've been a great addition, but we didn't have any.  If you like SPICY foods...try it this way.  I served it with white rice on the side.  YUMM!  I will make this again.  Thanks!

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
OMG - YUMMY! 
I changed the recipe a bit 'cause I'm on LA Weight Loss.
First I cut open the chicken breasts and used my own salt free taco seasoning and sprinkled very generously on all sides. The I used 1 TBSP peach pineapple salsa on the inside and 1/2oz of shredded skim dbl cheddar cheese folded the chicken breast half over put another 1 TBSP peach pineapple salsa on the top of the chicken breast. Baked in a preheated oven at 400 degrees for 22 min's putting another 1/2oz of cheese on top for the last 2 min's.  Topped it off w/ 1 TBSP low fat sourcream and dig in, very juicy, moist and flavourful. I will definately make this again.

text:
I love this recipe! I really like spicy, so I don't leave out the toppings like jalepenos, spicy salsa, etc. I do use the Ortega spicy hot taco seasoning. Very good. Only problem for me though is that the chicken breast isn't flavorful inside and it throws off the contrast of the spiciness on the outside. I personally would like to be able to have the whole thing spicy (inside & out) or even just flavorful! Any suggestions for this, please feel free to submit. My family & friends like this recipe, but I think they prefer it to not be so spicy! This recipe is fantastic. Thanks so much!

This was a big hit at my house!  I used 6 chicken legs with thighs, cut them up, rubbed the taco seasoning on them, and poured a whole jar of salsa over top of them and stuck them in the fridge to marinate overnight.  I covered dishes and at 35minutes, they were perfect!  Juicy, moist, and oh-so-flavourful!  I served this on top of The Best Spanish Rice from this site and with grated medium cheddar and sour cream overtop. Thanks!

userID:

Display Name:
BARNKITTY
isPro:

followersCount:
17

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/global/features/1747.gif
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Oh, this turned out so good.  Here's what we did: cut the chicken in large strips and coated with the taco seasoning.  Then mixed 1C Minute Rice with 1C water, the salsa, about 1C of corn, a chopped jalapeno, and a dash of cayenne.  Poured the rice mixture into the pan, then topped with the spiced chicken.  Baked for 35 minutes, then topped with 1C crushed tortilla chips and a mixture of Monterey Jack and cheddar cheese, and baked for 5 minutes.  It was SO good.  Served with sour cream on top.

Pounded the chicken breasts thinner and rubbed the taco seasoning mix into the breasts. This reminded me of something you would find on a buffet line -- Easy to prepare but it tastes like it was easy to prepare. Not horrible but not that great either. I do think that the type of salsa used makes a big difference and I will make this again but change the type of salsa. Sour cream is a must. Served with a black bean and rice dish from this site.

This was FAB!!!! So quick and easy and so few ingredients. 2. HE put away the leftovers.

region:

country:
None
text:
I modified the recipe and it came out great.  I marinated the chicken breasts overnight in a mixture of lime juice, olive oil, and some spices.  Then I pan fried it in olive oil cooking with shallots, just for a few minutes.  Then I put it in a casserole dish with 1.5 cups of salsa combined with the kernels I cut off 2 corn ears (very pretty).  I baked it at 375 for 20 minutes or so, then I put mozzerella cheese on top and baked it 5 more minutes.  At the end I put a dollop of sour cream on each breast and it came out great!  I served it with tomato basil rice from Uncle Ben's that I livened up with some spices.   Reasonably healthy and very presentable!

None
text:
I am amazed that anything this easy can be so good!  This is a wonderful recipe!  We like it so much that we adapted it for campout use ~ We make foil pouches, add 1/4 cup of rice, half a cup of water, then the chicken, seasoning, salsa, and cheese.  Seal up the pouches, and cook over the coals or fire.  It takes about 20 minutes to cook.  Awesome campout food, especially for tired hikers!  This is what my husband brought when it was his turn to provide meals for the adults at a Boy Scout campout, and it was a huge hit!  They tried to vote him in as perminent Grub Master (he objected).

text:
I used this recipe as a quick and easy way to make chicken for tacos. Followed the recipe exactly except I never added the shredded cheese or sour cream. After it cooled for a few minutes, I shredded the chicken using two forks. Put this chicken in some tacos topped with cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, sour cream, the works. Perfect and quick and easy! Will definitely use this recipe for chicken tacos going forth.

text:
Yummy!
I let the taco seasoning marinate overnight. I also put the chicken on the grill, 2 mins on both sides. I then placed the grilled chicken in a pan, added the chunky salsa, let it cook for 10 mins, added cheddar cheese, and cooked it for 5 more mins. I served it with spanish rice and tortillas on the side. Simple and delicious!

text:
This was the bomb as far as my family was concerned.  I have 1 that will eat anything and 4 that r so picky it's horrible!!  Like many others I used what I had.  We freeze meat when it's on sale.  I had mine with lemon pepper.  I put it n sheet cake pan, and per reviews added salsa in bottom of pan.  Sprinkled taco seasoning on top then rest of salsa on them.  Drizzled oil over them, baked @ 375 for 25 minutes.  Took out & covered with foil for 10 minuets.  Removed foil & sprinkled with cheese (lots) & put back in oven till it melted.  Wasn't good, was GREAT!!!  NO LEFTOVERS.  Son-n-law took pictures & showed @ work.  Every one wants recipes & thinks there's nothing I can't cook.  Again what was n kitchen was used.  Umm, left over cheese dip would have worked too & I forgot I had any.

userID:
13240269
Display Name:
Tiff_fa_fa
isPro:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/3679441.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I can't beleive I've never made this before.  The reason is probably that I fancy myself somewhat as a Home chef and this is just too easy. There's no chopping or prepping?! Clearly it can't be good enough for MY standards...WRONG! I finally tried it as I am desperate (as a new mom who also works full time) to find quick and easy family friendly but lean chicken dinners for our crazy week nights. This was a hit with everyone including my 1 yr old. I served it with yellow rice, black beans, and steamed spinach. I was pleasantly surprised with how flavorful it was, but the tenderness of the chicken was the best surprise of all. After reading reviews, I tossed the chicken breasts in a ziploc to coat it in the taco seasoning (I used ol el paso original). I placed a tiny bit of salsa on the bottom of the casserole dish, topped with chicken, then 1 cup of salsa ( I used medium tostitos), and baked for 35 min before topping with cheese and baking a few more minutes until melty. I topped the chicken with a dollup of sour cream and a slice of avocado. This is going on our regular rotation for its simplicity and deliciousness! :)

text:
This is remarkably good given the humble few ingredients. I used more taco seasoning than called for - just easier to dump it on. I also did the following and my hubby really, really like it:
In a 9x13: spread a little salsa, add a layer of crushed tortilla chips, a can of refried beans and a little more salsa. Add the chicken per recipe. Viola! Instant Mexican casserole!

text:
We really liked the dish...with some tweaks. Since several reviews mentioned serving with rice and beans, I decided to make it like my chicken and rice recipe. In the bottom of the 9x13 pan, I put salsa, 1/2 cup rice, 1 cup chicken broth and 1 can of drained and rinsed black beans. I put the chicken on top, covered with foil and baked at 400 for about 30 minutes. Our only complaint was that it seemed to spicy so I will reduce the amount of taco seasoning.  I served it with sour cream and finely chopped lettuce.  Very good and easy!! Thanks for sharing!

city:

region:

country:
None
text:
I'm eating the leftovers right now and my mouth is having a major party. THIS IS DELICIOUS. I used boneless, skinless chicken thighs (6ct) because of the added flavor. Other than that, I only made slight changes based upon my read of many reviews. I put a thin layer of Pace chunky salsa down on bottom of glass baking dish, then I did the taco seasoning on both sides of all chicken and placed it on top of that. I used a can of original Rotel over the top of the chicken (drained), and cooked as recommended to 35 mins. Removed, added copious amounts of cheddar cheese and returned to over for 5 mins longer. When I took it out, I put on top black olives and cilantro, and a few scallions. I served with sour cream and the best spanish rice from this site. Guys, this is superb. Reheated 2 days later, still awesome.

I make a crock pot version of this. I add a can of chicken stock to cook chicken in, in  the crock pot for about 4 hours. text:
I made this recipe following a few other reviews and just put half a pack of taco seasoning in the bag with the chicken and shook it together. I poured a little salsa on the bottom of the pan, placed the chicken on top of it and then poured the remaining salsa over that. I baked the dish for 25 min and then added Mexican shredded cheese and baked another 3. I topped mine with sour cream and jalapeÃ±os but for my boys I only used sour cream. I made Spanish rice as the side. I loved the chicken it reminded me of an enchilada without the tortilla. My 6 year old thought is was great as well but my 2 year old said it was spicy. Next time I'll make his following the instructions and only sprinkle it with a little on both sides. This recipe is definitely a keeper and super simple for the inexperienced cook like myself.

Display Name:
hanbell

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674133.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I've made this twice so far and we really like it.  I'm not giving it 5 stars primarily because I've not followed the recipe precisely. We really don't care for boneless, skinless breasts so I've made it with chicken thighs, both boneless, skinless and regular. As I wasn't using the amount of chicken the recipe called for, I didn't worry about measuring the rest of the ingredients. I used a taco seasoning recipe I found here and simply coated both sides of the chicken with it. Then I poured a nice quantity of salsa over the chicken so it was well coated. (We always use a medium, thick & chunky salsa and it worked great.)  Using more chicken and thicker pieces of it, I baked it for 45 minutes initially. The first time I made it we had no cheddar cheese so I finished off a package of shredded mozzarella & provolone to top to top it with. The second time we had a quality, really aged NY cheddar that I used. Both cheeses were delicious. My husband's first reaction to eating this was, "You can make this any time you want!"

I had no idea if I'd like this but It's now a regular addition to my menu.  I've since made some changes.  I did what another person did and put the seasoning in a bag and dropped the breasts in.  Then as she did, I put salsa on the bottom of the baking dish.  I also copied her idea of using a thick slice of Mexican melting cheese on top about ten minutes from the end.  I then put grated cheddar on five minutes later.  That makes it a ten star recipe. This is so simple!

Love, love, love this!  Such an easy weeknight meal!  We make it with the quinoa and black beans recipe also on this site.  Also, we follow the tips in the first review - use rotel instead of salsa, cook at 400 for 30-35 minutes, top with cheese then put back in oven for a few minutes then let it rest. text:
It's hard to believe a recipe with 4 ingredients, and is ready in 25 minutes, could be so good. After making it a few times I did change it a bit. To cook the chicken more evenly I pound the thick side of the breast so the whole breast is the same thickness, then instead of 1 cup of salsa I add the whole jar (650 ml), the sauce is very good on rice. The thinner chicken only needs 25 minutes to cook.

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
Quick and delicious! I had 3 chicken breasts thawed and had tired of the overused chicken recipes in my recipe box so went searching. Glad I did. This one came together so quickly and turned out to be just what I was looking for tonight. I had already put the chicken in the oven for 20+ minutes but pulled it out and added the taco seasoning on both sides. I also drizzled enough chicken stock onto the breasts to wet them enough for the seasoning to stick. after 40 minutes of cooking (total) I added shredded mexican cheese and covered with foil to rest. I served with home made mexican rice and carrots. YUMMIE!!

I have never cooked such tender chicken in the oven EVER! Even after re-heating the day after, the chicken was so tender & juicy, I had to check to make sure it wasn't undercooked, lol. city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I really enjoyed the basic recipe, adding the green onions and olives as some suggested.  I took a pork chop out of the freezer next day and, having some leftover taco seasoning, decided to use a similar method to cook it.  It was still partially frozen, so I started it in my toaster oven at 325 - after about 15-20 min, then I put some chicken gravy over it (rather than salsa) and put in the meat thermometer - for about 144.  I didn't add the cheese or anything else - but it was really moist and tasty.  Think I'll cook my pork chops in this similar fashion (maybe different seasoning and sauce) often.  Less trouble for one - and I cooked it on foil - no pans.

text:
This is a good recipe for slow-cooking shredded chicken for tacos or enchiladas.  I covered the chicken in taco seasoning, lined the bottom of the crock pot with salsa, placed the chicken on top, and added more salsa on it all.  Cooked on low for 6 hours; very easy to shred and a great taco meal!

text:
We eat a ton of chicken at our house so it's great to find a great new way to prepare it. The only thing I did differently is just throwing the cheese on  before throwing it in the oven (no need to add it 3-4 minutes before it being done). I just rubbed a bit of taco seasoning on the chicken breasts, topped with pace chunky salsa and then cheese. Turned out amazing!! I can't wait to try it again with maybe Mexican blend cheese or another flavor of salsa. This recipe is a keeper :) Thank you for sharing.

text:
I loved it and better yet, my picky little kids loved it!  I did do things slightly differently - rather than salsa, I used a can of mild Rotel tomatoes.  I also sliced up some onions and put in with the mix.  I didn't put the cheese on at the end; instead I cut up the chicken and made tacos out of it with soft flour tortillas.  The remaining rotel and onions in the pan made a great topping for the tacos, and we added the cheese as a topping for the taco.  So easy and so good!!

Display Name:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/198704.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I LOVE this recipe..... but I do have a few changes ;)  I marinate the chicken in a baggie with a can of rotel (we use original) and my spices (I use sea salt, black powder, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, cumin, chili powder and red pepper flakes). I make sure the spices/rotel is mixed VERY well before adding chicken. Allow to marinate in the fridge for a few hours and then put into baking pan, add salsa on top and bake according to original directions. When you go to add the cheese, we use mexican four cheese blend from kraft. The whole family loves this recipe and we serve it with corn and rice - YUMMY!

Absolutely WONDERFUL -- I wouldn't change a thing in the recipe. I used 8 boneless, skinless breasts and 2 packages of taco seasoning -- shook it all up in a bag, put it in the crock pot on top of a thin layer of salsa, and then covered all with the rest of the 2 medium-sized jars of salsa. YUMMY!

I did have to increase the baking time by 30 minutes but I think that was because I had prepared it earlier in the day and it went from the fridge to the oven. The chicken was very moist too.  GREAT RECIPE!  Will definitely make this again and again.  I am also sharing with friends and relatives.

text:
This is an often-repeated recipe in my home. It doesn't get any easier, and this is loved by everyone in my family, too! There's really even no need to measure. Generously cover both sides of the chicken with the taco powder then pour the salsa over the top. The final cheese layer is simply sprinkled on as you wish and dinner is ready to go with whatever vegetable you choose. This is one of our favorites. Thank you so much for this recipe!

I thought this was very easy and quite good. I made it in the slow cooker using three in-bone chicken breasts. The chicken fell off the bone.

text:
Always a hit here.  It's really hard to overcook the chicken with this for some reason.  I think it has to do with the salsa acidity.  I've found that the kick of the salsa mellows when cooked, so even a fairly hot salsa is tolerated well by all in our house.  Also, rather than taco seasoning (was out) I used cumin and garlic and it worked well.

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
12-11-09: A friend of mine referred this recipe to me and it was so good!  I always make my own taco seasoning, so I used that (chili powder, cumin, onion powder, paprika, cayenne pepper, garlic powder).  I didn't have salsa, so I used a 10oz can of Rotel diced tomatoes with green chiles and everything tasted delicious.  Next time, I will try this recipe as is with actual salsa. UPDATE 2-27-18, stopped making this recipe for some reason a few years ago, but made it again tonight and it's as great as I remembered it was! This time I combined a can of black beans (drained) and frozen corn. Spread on bottom of baking dish, added a couple Tbsp of water, and topped with a little taco seasoning. Then continued with the rest of the recipe, baking the chicken on top of the beans/corn! Excellent one dish meal! Goes great with mexican/spanish rice, cauliflower rice, or even a salad!

text:
Being single, I tend to freeze meals a lot.  This recipe was great.  I put some salsa in bottom of crock pot, seasoned 6 pieces of chicken in ziploc bag with taco seasoning in it, placed chicken in pot and covered with the rest of the salsa.  Six hours later, I divided the chicken into containers with juice added in each.  Then froze.  They have been so good to take to work and re-heat.  I didn't use the sour cream at all.

None
country:
None
text:
I've made this many, many times now and it always turns out great.  However, I use frozen chicken breasts and put them in the slow cooker, but use the rest of the ingredients the same way.  It only takes about 4 hours on low for them to be cooked through.  They are always so tender...you definitely don't need a knife with these.  I usually serve it with "Best Spanish Rice" from this site.  It makes a great meal!

text:
Family loves it. I marinate chicken in taco seasoning (with 2/3 cup water per package) for several hours before cooking. At end I take out all salsa, add about 1/2 to 3/4 cup of sour cream, and pour back over chicken. Top with cheese and put back in oven for 3-5 minutes to melt the cheese. They love the creamy salsa mixture.

text:
This was pretty good! I cooked it in the slow cooker as other reviewers had done. Didn't have a ton of flavor, next time I'll add more garlic powder and maybe some onion powder. For the flavor, I give it a 3, but the ease of the recipe can't be beat, so it gets a 5. I shredded the chicken and put them in corn tortillas with black beans and all the fixings. Couldn't get the 3 year old to touch it but hubby dumped habanero sauce all over his and loved it. I'll try this again for sure with a few tweaks.

Wow! What a GREAT and EASY to prepare recipe for chicken. My bf and I really, really enjoyed this. This was tastier than I expected. The chicken breasts were very tender and juicy. I used the taco seasoning mix from this site which is so economical, convenient and better tasting than the commercial packaged ones. As expected the males of the family inhaled this meal. I served with plain rice but a spanish or mexican rice would have made a better side. Overall very enjoyable and super quick and easy to prepare.

text:
This is fast becoming a favorite in my house. I pour the taco seasoning packet into about 1/2 cup of chicken broth or water and let that marinate all day, instead of sprinkling the chicken with it prior to baking. GREAT TIP: for an easy side dish (esp. if you're eating low carb like me), combine 3 tablespoons of the salsa with two cans green beans, drained. Add a little salt and pepper and heat through for a perfect pairing.

None
text:
It was tasty. My 15yr old scarfed it down in a minute, and snuck the leftovers for breakfast. I liked it but I think next time I make it I'll make a few changes. I think I'll try the "chicken" taco seasoning instead of "beef" and instead of sprinkling on the chicken I think it would be better to put seasoning in a shallow dish and dip chicken in, or shake in a bag as others suggested. That way the excess falls off and you don't get a powdery taste when your dish is finished. Nothing major just a few tweaks, can't wait to try this again. Thanks!

text:
My husband & I both LOVED this recipe. I used chicken  breasts sliced lengthwise into tenders to speed baking and make smaller portions of chicken for each person. When I sprinkled the cheese on top in the last few minutes of baking, I also added some crunched up tortilla chips. I served this with bowls of toppings at the table:  little shreds of romaine lettuce, chopped tomato, sliced green onion, and chopped cilantro. As other reviewers said, this was a little hot, but we enjoyed it that way. I was really wishing we had some avocado to put on top -- would help balance the spicyness.  Guacamole would be great too. To complete the meal, I made oven fries seasoned with olive oil, seasoned salt, cumin and oregano.

I made this dish exactly as instructed, only I used Tex Mex seasoning, which is just a little different then Taco seasoning. Everyone loved it, including my very picky husband and teenage daughter. I served it on top of plain rice, which worked well because as you cut into the chicen, the salsa and cheese mix with the rice. The kid didn't even complain that I used spicy salsa! I was actually asked to make this again!

I used Newman's Own brand salsa and I didn't measure the taco seasoning - I just made sure both sides of the chicken were covered. Used Tillamook cheddar cheese, which is always good. text:
A nice alternate for chicken. First I marinated my chicken in buttermilk for a few hours as I do with all my chicken(1cup milk 1 TBS vinegar or lemon juice if no buttermilk) for that extra moistness. I chopped up some fresh cilantro and added in with the salsa.  Topped with the cheese and sour cream this was quite tasty.  Served over rice.  I will make again.

YUM! i made this chicken last night...it was sooo easy..and sooo good! they guys devoured it! my changes: i made 3 chicken breasts 3 tsp of taco seasoning put them in a big ziplock and tossed I added like 2 Tbl. of chopped cilanto and 1/2 a squeezed lime in the bag - and marinated for 30min. baked - and added a slice of jalapeno jack cheese on top of each one at the end! Served over jalapeno refried beans, with a dalop of sour cream on top! with side of corn on the cob and spanish rice! mmm... it was soo good - next time i will use homemade salsa! must use the sour cream..it totally makes it!

text:
I LOVE this recipe!  This is one of my favorite dinners to make.  I usually add a few potatoes and bake it covered for 45 minutes.  Then I take the cover off, add the cheese and continue to cook for 5 minutes.  I've tried it both ways - with and without the potatoes - and it's definitely better with.  It's also good with a few frozen green beans thrown in.  Great recipe - thanks for posting it!

text:
Thanks Faye for a wonderful recipe.  After reviewing others suggestions I made a few modifications.  I used more salsa, I used chicken tenderloins, I also added 1/2 cup of chicken broth to the recipe for baking.  Since my tenderloins were frozen I cooked for an hour with aluminum foil cover.  After 1 hour I removed the aluminum foil and covered each tenderloin with slices of jalapeno montery jack and mexican blend cheese.  I also served these with the perfect baked potato (on this website) and refried bean with mexican cheese.

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
This recipe has made it to our monthly menu list!  I do leave out the taco seasoning as the chicken gets great flavor just from the salsa alone.  One thing that I do differently is to make it in the crock pot- it's easy and I can get it ready in the morning and it's ready when we get home.  Cook it on low for 6-8 hours, transfer to baking dish, top with cheese and bake for a few minutes until cheese is melty and you are good to go!  Even my picky husband who hates salsa loves this.  We serve it with cheesy mexican rice.

text:
Very good!  I did what another reader did "cut the chicken in large strips and coated with the taco seasoning. Then mixed 1C Minute Rice with 1C water, the salsa, about 1C of corn, a chopped jalapeno, and a dash of cayenne. Poured the rice mixture into the pan, then topped with the spiced chicken. Baked for 35 minutes, then topped with 1C crushed tortilla chips and a mixture of Monterey Jack and cheddar cheese, and baked for 5 minutes. It was SO good. Served with sour cream on top."
I woulld add just a little more salsa next time.

text:
This was really good, quick, easy, and healthy (when only a sprinkle of cheese is used - 1 cup is too much, in my opinion). I will make this again. I served it with g-ma's rice and black bean and corn salad II, both from this site. Great meal! By the way, once when I was in a hurry I made this in a frying pan (cooked over low heat w/ a tiny bit of olive oil) and it was almost just as good - I'll probably do it in a pan from now on because it's faster and not noticeably different in taste from the baked version.

text:
This was good. I didn't have taco seasoning. I just sprinkled the chicken liberally with chili powder, garlic salt, cumin, black pepper, and red pepper. I used a medium salsa and cooked for the indicated length of time, served with yellow rice, beans, and mexican corn. The medium salsa lent a lot of heat. I would recommend serving with sour cream to cut the heat (I didn't have any). There are other chicken recipes I like better but this worked well as a recipe using only what I had in my cupboard.

This was good, and, more importantly, so easy to make! I used an entire package of Lawry's taco seasoning. I also used the refrigerated kind of salsa that you find in the deli section, so I had to cook it about 15 minutes longer than called for, and use a turkey baster to get rid of the excess water. My boyfriend loved it, I loved it -- try it, you'll be glad you did.

text:
Made this again tonight for the first time in years.  Stuck to the original recipe but made some minor changes that I felt really elevated it.  I shook the chicken in a bag with the taco seasoning as so many recommended and marinaded it in the seasoning and salsa for about 4 hours.  I used a mixture of hot and medium salsa and I topped it with homemade Ranch dip instead of plain sour cream.  Served over taco rice and with a refreshing cucumber salad.  It was delicious.

This was wonderful.  I put the taco seasoning in a bag, added the chicken and shook the bag to coat the chicken.  I put half the salsa on the bottom of the pan before adding the chicken and the other half on top.  My husband and I both loved it.  The only change I would make is to cut the taco seasoning in half.  We both had tummyaches after dinner that I think was associated with all the spices.

5 stars across the board!!  What more could you ask for...absolutely moist & delicious and incredibly easy!!  I spread the taco seasoning on each piece of chicken using the back of a spoon, and it wasn't "overpowering" at all.  My husband is not generally a fan of taco seasoning or salsa, but even he like it. A definate keeper.  This is even a perfect recipe for an informal dinner with company.

text:
I'm usually a from-scratch chef, but the huge number of positive reviews convinced me to give this a chance.  It is TERRIFIC!  Based on suggestions from other reviewers, I used extra taco seasoning and shook it in a bag with the chicken, and I spread extra salsa on the bottom of the pan instead of greasing it.  Unbelievably easy and delicious!  This one has a permanent place in my quick-meal toolkit.

text:
I threw everything together, frozen chicken tenderloins, taco seasoning, green salsa, frozen southwest (corn/pepper/blackbean) veggie mix, raw onion, cooked in a casserole in the microwave.  Then added diced, tomato, cheese, sour cream and olives, and heated to melt.  20 minute dinner for hubby and I over shredded lettuce and tortilla chips.

text:
WE loved this recipe!! The chicken was sooo tender and juicy!! I wanted mine to be a little more spicy so I poured the taco seasoning into a ziploc bag and shook it all over the chicken, I also used 1/2 cup hot salsa with 1/23 cup medium.. It was so freakin delicious.. My husband wants it again next week.. I also added some sliced olives on top of the cheese and served it with warm garlic and cheese quesadillas... WE forgot the sour cream, it didnt need it, but we will try it next time... Definitely 5 stars!!!

text:
Could only give this 3 stars because I made changes.  I used thighs instead of breasts;....won't use chicken breasts in anything unless I've brined them first and was out of brined chicken breasts, plus I like thighs better anyway.  Otherwise followed the assembly as written I did add canned chopped chili peppers that I sprinkled over the salsa.  After baking the chicken dish for 45 minutes, I removed the foil and sprinkled a generous amount of shredded Monterey Jack cheese, instead of cheddar, over the top and heated until melted. I've made my version of this dish several times before and it's delicious.

text:
I made this recipe using other people's tips of putting the seasoning mix in a bag and shaking it over the chicken breasts.  I put a little homemade salsa in the bottom of the baking dish, added the chicken, poured the rest of the pint jar of salsa over the chicken and baked for 45 minutes (chicken breasts were pretty big).  Took it out of the oven and put Mexican melting cheese and cheddar on it, covered with foil and allowed to sit for 10 minutes.  Delicious!  Will make again.  Thanks for the great, easy recipe.

text:
This is a great recipe. I use at least a half packet of taco seasoning and I put the cheese on at the beginning so it bakes on top the whole time. I also slice the chicken breasts into 2 pieces so they aren't so thick. The dish is done when the cheese doesn't look smooth anymore and it starts to look more baked on to each chicken piece.  This takes at least 40 minutes or so.

I put on the taco seasoning then lightly browned in a frying pan. I sliced some onions and sautÃ©ed them also. Added onions on top then my salsa baked as recommended then added cheese until done. Served with Spanish rice, sliced avocado. On top of chicken I put some sour cream and cilantro! Making again soon!

This was really good! I actually put the chicken and the taco seasoning in a large bag and did a quick "shake-n-bake" thing to cover the chicken breasts.   I cooked  this in the  crock pot and it was so nice to come home and have dinner almost done!  All I did was shred the chicken and left it in the crock pot for about an hour  (while I settled in and got the side dishes going) to marinade in the sauce.  We had it on tortillas and it was delicious!
Review:
Rating:
5

Display Name:
Kevin McDonald
