photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/3426231.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Simple and tasty.  

I followed Jill C's advice with can on diced tomatoes with green chili.  They have a nice little bite to it but not enough to overpower.  

I'm never a fan of packaged taco seasoning.  I put some garlic powder, cumin,. paprika and chili into a sealed bag and tossed the chicken.  Also add some standard seasoning - salt/pepper.  

Very light spray of nonstick oil, and then the juice from the diced tomatoes.  Added the chicken then topped with the rest of the canned tomatoes.  

I happened to have some leftover fresh corn and white onions.  I piled all that onto the dish as well.  The sweet corn helped cut down the spiciness for my wife.  

Baked as directed, then add the cheese and finish baking, then let sit covered with foil for 10min.  We topped with sou cream and chopped lettuce and it was delicious. 

I'll probably look to serve with some nacho chips next time to scoop up all the extra drippings.  Chopping the chicken up into bite size pieces would probably make a really good dip.
Review:
Rating:
5
dateLastModified:
2017-05-01T19:41:03.133

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
Delicious and easy! I did make quite a few changes based on what I had on hand. I used 6 bone-in skin on chicken thighs and cooked covered on the stovetop in a heavy bottom pan with a lid for about 30 minutes on med-low as it's warm here and I didn't want to turn on the oven. I also mixed in about 1/4 cup of chicken broth to thin out the sauce. I mixed my own taco seasoning (1/2 tsp oregano, 1 1/2 tsp smoked paprika, 2 tsp cumin, 2 tsp chili powder, 1/4 tsp garlic powder) and used about half of that on the chicken. In addition to the cheese and sour cream, I sprinkled some chopped cilantro on top to finish. Thanks for a great recipe!

Display Name:
khoward_stl

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5677174.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I didn't do this EXACTLY, but read the reviews first and made some adjustments. I was making this for my husband and I and our 3-year-old.  So, I actually took a packet of fajita seasoning, because it tends to be milder, and put it in a ziploc and shook the chicken breasts in the bag until coated.  I preheated the oven to 400 degrees.  Then, I put the chicken breasts on a foil-lined baking dish with vegetable oil spray coating.  Then I spooned the liquid from a can of diced tomatoes with chilies into the ziploc bag with the remaining fajita seasoning and shook that up, cut off a corner of the bag, and squirted the juice onto the chicken breasts for extra marinade. I put the pan into the oven for 20 minutes.  Then, I spooned the diced tomatoes with chilies with a sprinkle of hot sauce on to our two breasts, and just put fresh cut cherry tomatoes on my sons.  Returned them to the oven for 10 more minutes.  When that was up, I sprinkled shredded mild cheddar onto all the breasts and returned to the oven for 3 more minutes until the cheese melted.  It was so juicy, perfectly cooked, and tasty.  Love this recipe!
Review:
Rating:
5

text:
I have been making this dish for 2 years now and I absolutely love it. I however made a few changes myself to my own personal liking.

Changed I made:
1- I remove the cheese as I am trying to cut some dairy out.
2- I chop up some jalapenos and add these to the already chunky salsa.
3- I chop into strips and pieces some red and yellow bell peppers and toss them into the already chunky hot salsa.

That's it, no cheese and some extra peppers!

Absolute perfection.

text:
Loved this recipe. Very easy to make. I had some cut up chicken pieces that I shook up in a bag with McCormick Taco seasoning and sprinkled pepper on top. Since I'm from San Antonio I had a whole jar of Riverwalk Cantina Salsa that I bought at Walmart. I didn't have to use any oil or grease I just put some salsa on the bottom with half a cup of water then poured the rest of the salsa on top covered with foil baked at 400 for 60 min then poured shredded cheese on top with oven off. My kids loved it! Will make again.

This was really good. I made some changes though. First of all I ran out of salsa. I only had about 1/2 cup of salsa, so I mixed that with salsa verde and some green chili hot sauce. Next, I cut some lime and red bell peppers and put those on top of the chicken and salsa. I then covered the pan with tin foil. Everything came out perfect! I gave my guests the choice to put it over Spanish rice or a salad. Everyone loved it.

country:
None
text:
I love this chicken recipe!! it is so easy and a real family favorite! I basically follow the recipe as written with some minor changes.
I find that most chicken breast are huge so I split them in have longways and sometimes pound them so they are all an even thickness.
I make my own taco seasoning from this site 
Taco Seasoning 1
I rub both sides with the seasoning and let them sit for a bout 15 minutes.  I top the chicken with fresh pico de gallo, I like the fresh taste of it, and it doesn't matter to me if it cooks a little.  
I serve this with Mexican Tomato rice ( from this site as well), roasted peppers and guacamole.  A great dinner.
Thank you for the very flavorful recipe!!

text:
I loved this recipe. The chicken is tender, juicy, and flavorful. I would recommend less taco seasoning if you don't like spice. Also, chicken breast halves aren't necessary. I just used 4 regular breasts.

As for the process and cleanup, the recipe is super easy to make and clean. I am not an experienced chef (as in I'd never handled raw chicken), and after figuring out the size of the breast, it was super easy. Plus, you only really need to clean the pan.

I loved this chicken recipe, and I don't usually like chicken. Thumbs up for this family favorite!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
As written, it is just ok.  To make it a 4-star I cook up some Spanish rice and cook up 2 diced zucchinis.  When the chicken is done I slice it up then put a bed of rice on the bottom of the casserole (13 X 9) and then the cooked zucchini.  I sprinkle on cheese then layer the chicken on top with more sprinklings of cheese.  Next I sprinkle on some chopped fresh cilantro and put the dish in the oven to melt the cheese.  Just before serving I sprinkle on some finely diced red onion.  Green onion would be great on top, too.  Love it with the suggested sour cream. Make sure to line the pan with foil as the chicken/taco seasoning burns.  Thank you for the inspiration!

text:
Added some Ortega hard taco shells with ground beef and all the works and some soft shells for the chicken salsa to be wrapped in. I also heavily coated the chicken in Old El Paso seasoning on the stove top in olive oil flipping the chicken until it was no longer pink.  Then I placed it in the oven taking it in and out  to add other ingredients such as the Tostitos salsa, cheese, then finally wrapping it in the soft shell and putting it back in to slightly harden the shell.

text:
A hit with the entire family.  Instead of salsa (which I'm sure is EASY and GREAT) I used Jill Canfield's suggestion of diced tomatoes with chilies.   I added the dash of Chipotle tabasco, which created some hot spots, so next time I would mix into the tomatoes and stir, before placing tomatoes on top, just to even it out a bit.  I made the Spanish Rice II by John Mac located on this site.  I used minute rice and used 2 cups instead, then of course you need 2 cups liquid.  I made my own chicken broth with bullion cubes to add more flavor (vs just water).  VERY VERY GOOD!  Will try again using Salsa like original recipe calls for, just to see which I prefer.

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
I didn't think it could turn out very good but it actually did. I was really short on time and threw the chicken in the oven after seasoning it with the taco seasoning and then covering it with Pace salsa (mild because - kids). Then baked it for about 45 minutes because my breasts weren't 100% thawed. Temped them to 165F and then added the cheese. I used a pre-shredded blend I had on hand and let it bake for about another five minutes. 
Served with some Mexican rice I made, corn, and tortilla chips. Added sour cream to the chicken and it was a super easy dinner I'll make again. 
My daughter gave it two thumbs up.

text:
Made this for my family and I got more than I expected when I cooked it in the oven! It took 55 minutes in total to prepare with frozen chicken breasts (they had to dethaw in microwave). I didn't have any taco seasoning, but I made my own, which turned out great! I used oregano, black pepper, chili powder, bayou Cajun powder, and kosher salt. It turned out delicious and my whole family enjoyed it!

text:
I followed directions with what I had on hand and it was a great dinner. Needed a quick way to use left over rotisserie chicken, slides, wings, legs Etc. Greased bottom of pan, added the cooked chicken pieces, sprinkled both sides w taco seasoning, poured a habanero chunky salsa on top, shredded cheese and warm for 15 min in the oven on 375. It was still juicy. 

As a side,  I microwaved uncle bens chicken rice and mixed with corn. Served with sour cream. This was super easy and delicious for a quick dinner.

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
I made this as specified, except I used a homemade taco seasoning (Taco Seasoning I on here) and first oiled the chicken breasts and then rubbed the seasoning on them.  Since my husband and little man are not huge fans of "spicy" food (I know, its a sin) I ended up one day putting some salt, pepper and olive oil on the chicken, pouring pasta sauce (whichever I have on hand) on top, and later melting an Italian shredded cheese mix on top.  Its basically the same recipe, but "Italian"(and not "spicy")! Either version takes pretty much 0 prep, and always comes out juicy and flavorful.  It is a hit in our house especially when making supper after work can't be a big production! I always bake it in a glass dish, covered with the glass top.

Wow. I have to say this was amazing. So quick and so delicious! I didn't make any real changes that would have made a big difference. I rubbed the taco seasoning in the chicken both sides, and placed it in the oven at 350 for an hour. Definitely will make again! Oh I used Pace Mild Chunky salsa if anyone was  wondering.

text:
Followed the recipe exactly, but made it in the crock pot.  Simplicity itself and so delicious!  There are only two of us so I have plenty of left overs to shred to use in burritos.  I served it with homemade quacomole  and sour cream and tortillas.   Hubby loved it and is looking forward to the leftovers.  As an added note, pick your favorite salsa to use in this recipe.  The salsa is what gives it the flavor so you don't want to use just any old salsa.  I'm going to try it with green salsa next time and  maybe even throw in some diced green chilies.  Great starter recipe.

text:
I followed another readers review and toss the chicken in a ziploc bag with a packet of taco seasoning. Then I pour a little salsa in the bottom of the casserole, add the coated chicken breasts, then pour over the rest of the salsa. I cook it for about 25 minutes. Then I remove it, and add some cheese (pepper jack is good, but any kind would be delicious), and cook for another 5 minutes. It is sooooo good!

text:
I made this a month ago for my husband and he loved it!  I did as suggested by another reviewer and put the taco seasoning (along with some additional cayenne pepper and chili powder) in a ziploc and gave it a good shake.  Then I added some salsa to the bottom of the baking dish before putting in the chicken.  I topped with a good dollop of sour cream and with some Spanish rice and refried beans this makes the perfect week night supper!

city:

region:

country:
None
text:
This was really good & really easy!  I used a package of taco seasoning mix, sprinkled it on top, then added some salsa (the rest of the jar: not sure of the amount), baked 50 min, then added cheese on top, baked until cheese was melted.  I did not use sour cream, as I didn't have any on hand.
I usually just cook chicken breasts on the stove top, then add salsa & simmer for like 45 minutes.  This is quicker, less time in the kitchen, and tastier.  Will definitely make again.
UPDATE: I made this as is, using the AR  Taco Seasoning I Recipe, and it was delicious!  My husband said the sour cream was a nice addition :)

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674141.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I loved this recipe for it's absolute simplicity very very easy to make. I tweeked just a bit . . . only did 2 chicken breasts . . . 1/2 tsp taco seasoning per side (keeping the 1 tsp per chicken breast format) . . . then . . . I used a full cup of fresh salsa (this is the tweek - recipe calls for 1 cup of salsa for 4 chicken breasts) The full cup kept the chicken very moist during cooking. I used a full cup because fresh salsa does not have all that juice that jarred salsa has and I did not want it to dry out . . . also,  I had the fresh on hand and wanted to use it up as it usually goes bad before we can use it all! I could have covered  the pan as the tip below suggests . . .but I kinda liked the idea of the salsa getting a little 'baked'. If I had used jarred salsa I would have only used 1/2 cup for the 2 chicken breasts & I am sure it would have been fine. I really liked it but my husband not so much. He doesn't care for food that is even mildly spicy . . . and this was mild . .  used mild fresh salsa.

text:
was very good, I (daughter in law gave me recipe that is
easier, and just as tasty if not tastier...I thought I would never buy/eat chicken thighs  tried it at their home was delish!!!
1 lb chicken breast ( or thighs as you like)
1 container calif beach hut salsa (in refrigerated aisle shop rite.
oven at 350.
place chicken in roasting pan, cover with salsa, cover with alum. foil, bake 1/2 hour, take cover off pan, cook another 1/2 hour        test for doneness,   now, bring out what ever you like, I used white rice 
go for it!! it will be a hit!  and simple!!!!

Display Name:
Emery DeWald

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/2554755.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Easy, great meal to make in the slow cooker.  The house smelled great and our gang could not wait to eat it.   I used a slow cooker liner for easy clean-up.  I pounded the chicken breast flat, mixed a packet of Ortega Taco Seasoning with 2/3 cup of olive oil and brushed on the mixture to both sides, poured some salsa on the bottom of the pan, placed two chicken breasts on the salsa, poured more salsa on top of them,  placed the other two chicken breasts on top of that, poured the remainder of the salsa on them, and cooked them for four hours on high.  After they were done, I placed the breast in a pan, sprinkled on shredded cheese, and placed them in pre-heated oven to melt the cheese.  I served them over Near East Spanish Rice and with Birdseye Southwestern Corn.  Good, easy meal which I have been asked to make again soon.
Review:

I have been making this for years and we love it....great flavor and so simple.  I toss the chicken in a bag with the taco seasoning and then place it in pan and top with the salsa. text:
Cooked chicken smothered in low sodium taco seasoning in a crock pot on low for about 3 hours then I put in 1/2 the salsa and cooked another 2 hours. once done I put the chicken and all sauce in a glass pan. I added sauted green peppers and sweet onions on top of the chicken. then put the layer of cheese that I shredded. I used the Mexican brand cheese "quesadilla".   Lastly I added the other 1/2 of the salsa and put in the oven til cheese melts.

text:
This is a favorite at our house. I thought I had made it up! I often pound the chicken breasts first. I sprinkle with salt and a teaspoon of chilli powder. I brown the chicken breasts and put them  in a glass baking dish. I use a fresh salsa, not the cooked type. Pour the  whole jar over the chicken. I like to pour a mini-carton of quality chicken broth over the top. Finally I sprinkle with cheddar cheese. I bake it cover with foil at 375 degrees for 30 minutes. I usually serve it with saffron rice, fresh corn, and/or fresh pineapple. The chicken comes out tender and yummy!

text:
A couple alternatives to this incredibly good recipe.  I put a layer of salsa in a crockpot, add frozen ( how simple is this?)boneless, skinless breasts, then top with remaining salsa.  I leave this for 6-8 hours on low. I also throw in a cubed block of low fat cream cheese, yes there is till extra calories...so it's not everyone's option.  This makes the salsa a more creamy texture to top the breasts with upon serving.  I have also shredded the chicken and placed it on a bed of Spanish rice or a rice and bean blend.  Great recipe and couldn't be easier!

text:
I tweaked the recipe some. I didn't have enough breast for a family of 5 the first time I made this, so I cubed it instead, then I put chicken in quart size bag and added seasoning to bag and let sit for about 20 minutes. I line my dish with foil, put instant rice in the bottom and put enough water to just cover the rice. Then follow the rest of the recipe. My children ask me on a weekly basis " Mommy when are we having that chicken salsa stuff"  Even My husband asks for it. So glad I found this easy to make recipe.

text:
The first time I made this, I felt like it needed something.  The second time was much better; I poured a 15 oz can of drained and rinsed black beans on top of the seasoned chicken and then poured an entire 16 oz jar of salsa on top of it.  FYI, a 1 oz package of taco seasoning mix holds 12 tsp, so this recipe only calls for 1/3 of a package.  Also, in case you buy chicken by the pound and not by the breast like I do, I found that 2 lbs (maybe a bit more) worked well.  Tasty and very simple.

userID:
278635
Display Name:
Amy
isPro:
False
followersCount:
2
followingCount:
0
madeRecipesCount:
215
favoritesCount:
1168
recipesCount:
0
reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/global/features/3056.gif
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
copied from another review....substituted a can of RoTel..have been making it without the salsa ever since!). I put the entire package of taco seasoning (low sodium variety) in a ziploc bag, and dredge the chicken breasts. Next, I poured some of the liquid off the tomatoes into the bottom of an 8x8 glass baking dish (I did this instead of greasing). I then placed the chicken breasts in the dish, and added a little fresh cracked pepper, and topped them with the tomatoes, and a dash or two of chipotle tobasco sauce. Bake in a 400f oven for 30-35 mins- or if you cook with Science...temp to 140...carryover heat will finish it off) Remove from oven. Sprinkle with cheese and place back in oven for 3 mins or till cheese has melted. (here's where carryover comes into play...) After your cheese is melted, take it out of the oven and remove it from the baking dish. Cover with foil and let it rest for about 10 minutes. This lets all the juices reabsorb. Top with a dab sour cream. I serve this usually with spanish rice, mexican style corn (for this type of corn in a jiff...add some red/black pepper flakes, a little mrs dash,and 2-3 dashes of tobasco sauce..the man will even sometimes top the corn with a dab of shredded cheese), and a salad. Thanks for a great recipe!! Definitely a keeper!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
use low fat sour cream, 2% cheddar cheese, low sodium taco seasoning, Newman's Lime Salsa and use bone in and chicken skin on as there is only a 14 calorie difference and the flavor difference is amazing. One can choose to remove skin if desired. Make sure to not overcook and let chicken rest before serving, on yellow rice and or blacks beans (rinsed). Garnish with fresh cilantro! OLE!

The biggest downside to this recipe is the packaged taco seasoning, which is pure salt, caramel color?  and all kinds of mystery ingredients.  I would give this all thumbs up if:  use homemade taco seasoning, lots of nice recipes out there;  reduce the cheese; AND use Greek yogurt instead of sour cream.

Wow!  Super Easy!  Great Taste!  Super flexible.  Use less seasoning and mild salsa for those who don't like spicy.  More seasoning and hot salsa for those who do like spicey.  Use small prepackaged breasts that thaw quickly or huge breasts for those who like lots of meat.  Serve over rice, serve over pasta, or serve with a baked potato.  Love it, love it, love it!  Thanks for the recipe!  This recipe is going in our permanent rotation!

text:
This recipe was really good but, most importantly, it was soooo easy and I had all of the ingredients at home already!  I didn't measure out the taco seasoning or bother putting it in a bag, I just poured some on the chicken breasts, patted it in, and flipped them over and did it again. Based on another review's suggestion, I used the Pace thick and chunky.  It was great!  I used Old El Paso's low sodium taco seasoning and medium salsa and it wasn't very spicy.  Next time I may do something to kick up a bit.

text:
Like others suggested I marinated the chicken in the taco seasoning for a few hours before baking. I followed the recipe exact except I did not measure the salsa and cheese. I spooned the salsa over the chicken and made sure they were covered and sprinkled the cheese in the same fashion. It came out awesome. The only thing I may try next time is to add a tablespoon or two of lime juice to the marinade, other than that I wouldn't change a thing!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was the best and easiest chicken casserole I've made in years!!  Didn't have to add anything extra.  Followed it exactly.  For taco seasoning, I used McCormicks Mild.  For salsa, I used Tostitos Mild.  Perfect blend of spices and flavors.  I love cheese so I was generous.  You really need to let it set for several minutes after baking to let the sauce thicken a bit and served with a dollup of sour cream and a sprinkle of chopped green onions.  I prepared this dish a few hours before guests arrived, then let it set out a few minutes because it was chilled, put it in the oven for less than an hour and done.  I used skinless, boneless thighs, (personal preference)I served Spanish rice, corn and salad for my sides.  My guests loved it!!  Keeper forever!

userID:
2402378
Display Name:
Erin
isPro:
False
followersCount:
20
followingCount:
0
madeRecipesCount:
149
favoritesCount:
890
recipesCount:
0
reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/46210.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I wasn't sure I was going to like this -- it looked too simple and pedestrian to be great. Boy was I surprised. I used organic chicken, Newman's Own pineapple salsa and the taco seasoning 1 recipe from this site.  Shook the chicken breasts in a ziplock bag with the taco seasoning until they were coated. Layered the bottom of a ceramic baking dish with salsa. placed the chicken on top of the salsa. Spooned more salsa over the top of the chicken. I baked it at 400 for about 40 minutes (thick breasts). In the last ten minutes I sprinkled the top with green onion and covered with lots of Mexican shredded cheese blend and baked until cheese was melted. I served this with Near East Spanish rice (which is the bomb) and made my own guacamole and severed it all with sour cream. This was an excellent meal for a weeknight. Fast, super easy and very tasty. You could even slice the meat and toss everything into a soft tortilla. This will go into the regular rotation.

AWESOME recipe for the working mom.  Put a layer of salsa on bottom of crock pot, lightly dredge chicken with Taco Seasoning (I used about 1/3 of the packet, low-sodium - otherwise, too salty!).  Per other user's recommendations, in addition to the salsa, I poured in a can of cream of chicken....cooked on low for 8 hours...mmmmmmm, perfect!!  served with the Quinoa and Black Beans on this site.  YUM!!!

text:
All of these reviews sound absolutely wonderful.  I may consider making some changes every once in while to mix things up.  Fortunately this recipe works well on its own.  The only thing I did change (out of necessity) was the seasoning.  I didn't have taco seasoning and was too lazy to make my own (which I have done before using a Allrecipes recipe.) Instead, I used Tastefully Simple's Yahoo! seasoning.  Not sure how or if that changed the recipe significantly but the the chicken was incredible.  It was fast and easy, and my husband and kids enjoyed it.  All was right with the world.  :-)  Enjoy!

text:
Chicken ends up moist inside.  A quick and tasty recipe - not quite entertaining quality, but good for a weekday dinner. I used nonfat Greek yogurt instead of sour cream... it is sort of essential to this recipe if you eat it in a tortilla, so would say it's not really optional.  Otherwise, chicken can taste a bit one note with not enough textural variation.

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
My "after-the-fact" observation is that this recipie is a no-brainer, but I never thought of it. It is super yummy! I did change it a bit given what I had in the pantry and how we wanted to eat dinner. I am a HUGE fan of the Taco Bell seasoning (in my humble opinion, it is the best out there short of going to the Mexican trucks parked on the side of the road - THOSE ARE THE BEST!!!) I used the Taco Bell Chipotle Taco Seasoning for the chicken, I reserved a little over 1/2 of the package and was very generous with the salsa. I did not bake it with the cheese at the end, instead, I shredded the chickn in the hot salsa and mixed it all together. We used the chicken on the top of taco salads and the sauce in the pan was more than enough for the salad. I used the remaining package of seasoning to season the rice while it cooked. Very yummy! Thank you!

text:
So easy, and so tasty! I pulled the chicken out at the end, shredded it, then back into the sauce. I used a couple tablespoons of corn starch to thicken up the sauce, and added a bit more sour cream (mixed into the sauce). After all ingredients marinated in a warm slow cooker for awhile I piled the shredded chicken into soft taco shells. Yum! Makes great leftovers too.

I'll use foil underneath my chicken next time.

text:
Perfect recipe!  Simple, quick, delicious.  When I went home to make this a few weeks ago I found that what used to be a full jar of salsa was now only a couple of tablespoons.  So I changed things up a bit with great success.  Next to the near empty jar of salsa was a half jar of leftover homemade pizza sauce.  So I sprinkled the chicken with some Italian seasoning and a little garlic salt, covered them with pizza sauce, baked as directed, topped w/cheddar cheese and finished baking.  Fantastic!!  Not sure which way I prefer - the Mexican or Italian version - but excellent recipe!

text:
The only reason that I'm giving it 4 instead of 5 stars is because my boyfriend and I love spicy food, so we tweeked the recipe a tad.  Instead of 4 tsp of taco seasoning, I used a whole packet and sprinkled it over the 4 chicken breasts along with a sprinkling of seasoning salt.  I also added onion slices and fresh mushrooms on top of the chicken and then added the salsa.  I used up 2 slices of pepper jack cheese that I had left over and also added shredded cheese (mexican style blend).  My boyfriend and I really liked it!  We ate it with sour cream on top, mexican rice, and tortillas.  We ended up ditching the tortillas and just ate the chicken! I would definitely make this again!

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/148471.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Phenomenal!!! This was one of THE BEST chicken dishes I've ever had!!! I seasoned the chicken with Taco Seasoning I from this site and spooned enough salsa over the breasts and around the dish with some extra salsa liquid poured in. I put the dish into the fridge for about 10-15 minutes while preparing Mexican Rice II from this site. I let the chicken bake for 30 minutes before throwing a couple of slices of colby jack (closest thing I had to cheddar) on top of each breast. At that time, I also threw some spinach into the dish and mixed it into the liquid. I turned on the broiler until the cheese was bubbly and golden. The chicken was sooo moist and tender from baking in the salsa!!! It also had great flavor from the seasoning! My mom, who hates chicken breasts because they tend to be dry, loved this dish! She couldn't believe chicken breasts could actually be so tasty and tender! I can't wait to make salsa chicken again! Thanks! I just realized I had forgotten all about the sour cream. Either way, it was still delicious!

text:
Great Recipe, I changed it up just a little. First I pound out the chicken breast then I season with Salt, Garlic Powder and pepper. I then use two packs of taco seasoning in a ziplock bag and coat each breast with the taco seasoning. I cook two boxes of Spanish rice and put the rice in the baking dish. I place the chicken breast over the rice and top with chucky salsa and bake for 30 minutes. The last 5 minutes I add the shredded cheese and crunched tortilla chips. This is a regular in our house!

text:
I didn't have any taco seasoning, and noting other reviewers' comments regarding the saltiness I decided it would be OK to skip that.  I just seasoned the chicken with salt, pepper, chili powder, garlic powder, and cumin, then put it in the baking pan and covered with the salsa.  I used cheese slices instead of the grated cheese, which ends up being a little neater.  This turned out very tender and tasty, and couldn't have been easier.

text:
YummmmYummmmmYummmmm.....I used three large chicken breasts and sprinkled the taco seasoning on them freely (no measuring here) then covered each with an equal amount of salsa (probably more than the 1c called for in the recipe as the pieces of chicken were quite large).  I baked until just done, sprinkled cheese over them and finished cooking as the cheese melted. I then sliced the chicken into 1/2 thick strips and placed 3 or 4 slices on a warmed low carb tortilla that I had spread liberally w/ low fat sour cream, then I topped then with a smidgeon of freshly grated jack cheese.  These were wonderful....kudos for sharing such a simple yet wonderfully flavorful recipe.

Our entire family enjoyed this recipe. I make my own salsa (very hot) and so I didn't top the chicken that my boys at with it. My only critique is following the advice of others of putting chicken in a baggie and coating it with the taco seasoning. That made the chicken too salty with coating on all sides. We'll sprinkle it on as stated in the recipe. Thanks!

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
This is one of those recipes that is *so* easy that you wonder why you hadn't thought of it before.  A snap to put together, ingredients I typically have on hand anyway, but easily accommodating and/or changeable.  I used mild salsa, taco seasoning that I had left over from a couple weeks ago (half of a spice pack) and 2% colby jack cheese.  I used five thin chicken cutlets and they only took about fifteen minutes to cook; who needs a thirty minute meal when you have a twenty minute one?  Served with Spanish rice (from a package, I'm lazy), fat free refried beans and corn.  Made great leftovers, as well!

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/2319815.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This is excellent! I sliced 3 chicken breasts in half to reduce cooking time. I followed the recipe pretty much - used a bit of seasoned salt and taco seasoning from the "Taco seasoning 1" recipe from this site. I sprinkled it on and let stand for 1.5 hrs. I used X-sharp freshly shredded cheddar and a Medium salsa. Baked about 20 mins then added the cheese and baked about 7 more minutes. The chicken was juicy and just so yummy. I made a mix of corn, red peppers, green chili peppers and black beans w a touch of cumin. I also used the Spanish Rice II to complement the rest of the meal. Can't wait for tomorrow to finish the leftovers.

AWESOME!!!!

Awesome, easy recipe that can be so versatile.

text:
OK, funny story about this recipe...  I was sick so my BF offered to make it since it was super easy.  I get home from work, go upstairs to change and he comes up 2 min later with a sad look on his face confessing he already "messed it up."  He cut the chicken into chunks and dumped all the taco seasoning on it.  At least he tried.  The chucks actually worked out (no cutting as we sat infront of the TV to watch a movie), but we did have to wipe off a lot of the seasoning.  We served it over brown rice and I think we might add kidney beans next time just to add some nutritional value.  Such a yummy quick and easy recipe.  Thank you so much!  We will def make this again (and read the directions).

text:
This was surprisingly good, considering the simpicity of it. I always prefer using this method (baked @350)for boneless chicken breasts (with various different coatings/toppings) because it comes out very moist. We forgot to use the sour cream until halfway through, and it was fine with or w/o. The only negative was, it was a little salty... probably from the salsa cooking down. Will try a low-sodium or different brand next time. Excellent for a weekday or even a company dinner! After reading reviews, I served with "Vigo" brand  saffron (yellow)rice and green beans. I agreed with the reviewer that said a non-spicy/Mexican side dish would pair better. Thank you for the great recipe!

None
text:
So a few things here. I used really big chicken breasts and while they were very juicy they were completly bland. All we tasted was chicken & sour cream, none of the salsa, cheese or seasoning. I even used 4 tbsp taco seasoning. So if you plan on using big chicken breasts, either add more taco seasoning or wait until you have smaller. I do plan on trying again using smaller ones. I figured it would turn out good with all of the good ratings and it sounds really good too.

Display Name:
Donna Pratt

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/1471703.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Fabulous!  I made slight changes which were: 2 pkgs of taco seasoning mix placed into a large ziplock bag. I rinsed chicken, shook off excess water then placed one breast at a time in the bag and shook to coat the chicken.  Shake off excess seasoning.  I used 2 cups of salsa and a bit more cheddar cheese.  Absolutely a keeper!!  My husband, who is not a particular fan of sour cream said that the sour cream was an absolute must with this recipe.  Perfect blend of flavors.  
As another member had done, I made the Best Black Beans to go with this.  Slight changes on that recipe were I used 1/2 tsp Cumin instead of the Cilantro and I added 2 tsp of lime juice.  (Other ingredients I used per recipe.) Brought everything to a boil, then covered the pan and simmered on low for 20 mins.  I served the beans over Mahatma (brand) yellow rice which I cooked in the microwave.  A wonderful dinner!!!

I have made this several times, and everyone always loves it. I use original old el paso taco seasoning (I've tried other seasoning, but this is the one that I think is the best) and lots of cheese (cheddar and mozzerella with garlic). This was wonderful! Made it for dinner last night and my boyfriend and I loved it.  I used a whole packet of taco seasoning and coated 6 pieces of chicken, laid them in the 9X13 and poured a mixture of medium salsa with mild picante sauce all over the chicken. city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
i tried this recipe once before, preparing it as directed. it turned out ok...but nothing amazing. tonight i made it slightly different and it turned out great! i used thin sliced chicken breasts, and pico de gallo (fresh salsa) instead of the kind sold in a jar (such as pace). i dumped almost the entire container on the 5 pieces of chicken, threw them in the oven and cooked them until white. i then shreaded cheddar cheese on top and put back in the oven for about 3 minutes. last, i topped it w/ fat free sour cream. it turned out so good and it couldn't be easier! it was much fresher tasting than the last time.
